resources.string: Gegenstand für den Transport wird gehalten
Reise an folgenden Ort: {POITags}.
Suche in Truhen nach Folgendem: {itemName}
Sammle: {itemName} (Beute von: {targetName})
Beschaffe: {itemName}
Stelle in deinem Lager Folgendes her: {itemName}
Defeat {targetName} at {POITags}
Another survivor? Saints be praised! It's always good to find a live one.\n\nThat storm was fierce. I figured it would drown the lot of you.
"Who are you?"
Me? Oh, I'm Charity, er, Watcher Douglas, from the Monarch’s Bluffs settlement.\n\nAnd who do I have the pleasure of meeting today?
"My name is {playerName}."
Well, {playerName}, I know this isn't the best way to make an acquaintance, but it's actually the way most people arrive here.\n\nI suppose you're still wondering where 'here' is.
The Rest of the Crew
"What's so different about Aeternum?"
On the good side, we generally don't ever age or die here, at least not in any natural way.\n\nOn the bad side, there's what happened with the rest of your crew.
"What happened to them?"
Well, see, they came back to life, but without their souls. They're wandering around the beach all aimless like. \n\nThe kind thing is to at least try and put them down for good. Would you mind?
Defeat the Drowned wandering around the shipwreck on the beach, and then return to Watcher Douglas at the Monarch's Bluff Watchtower.
It's an icky task, isn't it? But it's part of life here on Aeternum.\n\nMay as well get used to it!
Open the Map
Investigate the Shipwreck marked on your map
Defeat {targetName}
Defeat {targetName}
I know you didn't enjoy that. But once their souls are gone, it's the most you can do for them.\n\nI wish I could say you eventually get used to it, but you don't, not really.
A Skinning Knife
"Are there any supplies here?"
Oh dear, where are your manners, Charity? I'm sorry, {playerName}.\n\nAfter everything you've been through today, you're probably starving, aren't you?
"Do you have something to eat?"
I didn't think to bring anything, but I can show you how to make do.\n\nGet some flint and wood, then make yourself a skinning knife at the fire. That's a start, at least.
Get to it. That skinning knife's not going to make itself.
Gather Flint and Wood nearby, then interact with the Watcher's campfire to craft a Flint Skinning Knife, then talk to Watcher Douglas.
Collect Materials
Gather {itemName} from the ground
Gather {itemName} from a bush
Craft a {itemName} at the Watcher's campfire
Got your skinning knife, eh? It's not exactly pretty, but it'll do the job. \n\nI mean, don't feel bad. I've certainly seen worse.
Rustle Up a Meal
Oh, Right! Now that you got your little knife, you can rustle up a meal.\n\nThere's lots of boar about. Hunt one down, skin it, roast the meat on the fire, and that should tide you over.
"Sounds like a plan."
Pick yourself a fat one, if you can. This is actually a good hunting spot.
Hunt and Butcher a Boar, then craft a Light Ration at the Watcher's campfire, and then talk to Watcher Douglas.
Hunt {targetName} for a meal
Equip a Skinning Knife
Skin a Boar to Collect {itemName}
Cook a Light Ration at the Campfire
Cold beach like this? Nothing like a warm meal by the fire.\n\nI bet you’re glad you took the time.
Stories Among Ships
"Anything else you need help with?
I'm afraid so. That was a freak storm that wrecked your ship, all these ships.\n\nI mean, it's Corruption that causes storms off the coast all the time, but that was the worst I've ever seen.
"What is the Corruption?"

It's that nasty red stuff, kind of... an evil magic. Being Corrupted is even worse than being Lost. \n\nThe Corruption forms a ring around Aeternum and smashes any ships approaching and any that try to leave.
"Is there any way to fight it?"

The storms are just a fact of life here. The best we can do is keep records of all the ships the Corruption claims.\n\nIn fact, if you could scrub these wrecks for any keepsakes, the settlement will want them.
I should've mentioned it before, but if you see any Corruption lingering about, I'd say avoid it at all costs.
Search for survivors and bring back any records or remnant items from the shipwrecks. Watch for signs of Corruption as well. Then return to Watcher Douglas at the Monarch's Bluff Watchtower.
Search Shipwrecks for Records and Remnants
From Capili's Coronation:
Collect Ship's Roster
Collect Ship's Manifest
Collect Ship's Log
Search Ship's Locker at wreck of {POITags}
From Bounty of Boehm:
Collect the {itemName} from the Stern
Collect the {itemName} from the Bow
That's nice. You found a fair amount of records, I'd say.\n\nThe Monarch's Bluffs settlement keeps all this, as a kind of memorial, I guess.
One Last Thing
"What else do you need?"
I can't leave until I'm sure that any Corruption down here has been dealt with.\n\nYou can probably tell I don't actually savour this kind of thing. I was wondering… maybe you could help me out?
"Of course. What can I do?"
I know the Corruption that remains is coming from the sea cave - Turtlespit, we call it.\n\nIf you could go in there and just… deal with it, it would make my day. But {playerName}… do be careful.
Before we can leave here, we have to deal with any Corruption. Of course, that doesn't mean taking unnecessary risks.
Explore Turtlespit Cave and root out the source of the lingering Corruption, and then return to Watcher Douglas at the Monarch's Bluff Watchtower.
Investigate Turtlespit Cave
Search for the Source of the Corruption
Defeat the {targetName}

Did you destroy it? Whatever it was in Turtlespit? Oh, saints be praised! That's a relief.\n\nSeriously, if we left some source of Corruption down here, it would spread all over Monarch's Bluffs in a matter of days.
Storm Warning
"I'm glad I could help."
The thing is, even with the source of Corruption gone, this is still a really bad sign.\n\nOne of us needs to take word back to the Monarch's Bluffs settlement. We need to warn them.
"Which do you prefer?"
I prefer we go back together, but it's my duty to stay. \n\nYou go. Take this message to Constable Saville. We've been worried about Corruption surging like this for a long time.
Like I said, I really did enjoy your company, but that message needs to get to Constable Saville. \n\nI'll see you around the settlement later at least, I hope.
Travel to the Monarch's Bluffs settlement and talk to Constable Saville.
With every new face, I wonder, will those eyes soon glow red with Corruption?\n\nThat storm, then Shattered Mountain erupting? I think the moment we've dreaded has come.
"I have Watcher Douglas's Report."
Let me see… yes, Charity reports the Corruption nearly got a foothold on the beach.\n\nYou must be the {playerName} she mentions here. Very well, you're welcome to Monarch's Bluffs.
Warn the Magistrate
"What happened to the madman?"
Oh, he wandered off, disappointed and angry, well on his way to becoming Lost, I suspect.\n\nI heard rumors of a creepy old man fishing by the western river. Could be the same one. Who knows?
"You think the Corruption will come here?"

Most likely. The time has come for us to batten down the hatches and seal the settlement off.\n\nTake Charity's report to Magistrate Bixford. He and I have discussed this possibility. He knows what must be done.
Take the report to Magistrate Bixford. He can take it from there.
Take the Watcher's Report to Magistrate Bixford.
Let me guess - you've brought back the Watcher's report, have you not?\n\nI knew it as soon as you passed by, you see.
"Yes. I have the report here."
I don't need to read it. The storm, the eruption of Shattered Mountain. None of it's a surprise to me.\n\nYou, I had not anticipated, however. This is an ominous day to arrive on Aeternum.
Make Yourself at Home
Visit the Inn and reserve a room to bind yourself to it, and then talk to Magistrate Bixford.
"It's not like I planned it."
Of course not, and I must not forget my role as a gracious host.\n\nYou should check in at the inn, and make yourself at home here. Return later, and we shall talk more.
Visit the innkeep and let him know you will need a room. It will cost you nothing.
Talk to Innkeep Biton and Check in at the Inn
There now, even in a strange land, one must get situated.\n\nI read Charity's report - {playerName} - you're quite a hero... by her account.
Supplies and Storage
"I'll help if I can."

Indeed. I will put all of the town's resources at your disposal. \n\nYou can acquire supplies - or sell them - at the Trading Post, and I have allotted you a Storage Space. Go and see them for yourself.
Visit the Trading Post and the Storage Shed, and then return to Magistrate Bixford.
You must learn your way about town if you mean to stay. Visit the Trading Post and the Storage Shed.
Open the Trading Post
Open a Storage Shed
Well, {playerName}, I believe I've helped you become acquainted with the settlement. \n\nWe are... very happy to have you here.
Settlement Priorities
"Is there anything else I should do?"

Yes. Constable Saville has begun shaping her plans for securing the settlement against Corruption. \n\nShe asked specifically for your assistance in the work. You should speak with her as soon as you can.
Constable Saville is in the Town Hall. It's a rare moment when that's not the case.
Talk to Constable Saville in the Monarch's Bluffs Settlement.
{playerName}, how nice it is to see you again.\n\nI was thinking about whom to appoint as the architect of the settlement's defense, and your name came to mind.
Order of Business
Complete various tasks for Constable Saville to shore up the settlement's defenses in Monarch's Bluffs.
"What can I do for the settlement?"
The first order of business is to gather raw materials and refine them at one of the workshops about town.\n\nIf your hands are not calloused yet, they soon will be.
You'll have to leave the safety of the settlement to gather wood, stone, and rawhide. \n\nThe wilderness has these in bulk. Then you must refine the resources in the workshops around town.
Well done, {playerName}. Your willingness and practicality are… refreshing.\n\nEven I myself struggle at times with a sense of resignation.
Complete Marshalling Resources
Complete Refined Tastes
Interact with the Monarch's Bluffs Town Projects board
Gather {itemName} by Mining Boulders
Gather {itemName} by Skinning Wolves and Boars
Gather {itemName} by Chopping Down Trees
Wood, stone, and rawhide. Exactly what was requested.\n\nThis is good, but it's only a beginning.
BLANK
Gather wood, stone, and rawhide. Then bring them back to Constable Saville.
Marshalling Resources
BLANK
Craft {itemName} at the Woodshop
Craft {itemName} at the Stonecutting Table
Craft {itemName} at the Tannery
There now. If your hands were not calloused before, I am certain they are now.\n\nTimber, Stone Blocks, and Leather - it's amazing what humans can accomplish with a few simple items.
BLANK
Visit the workshops and use the equipment to refine your raw resources.
Refined Tastes
BLANK
Artificer Gomes
"I'll do whatever I can."

I know you will. In fact, there is someone else you should speak with, Estebanita. You would know her as Artificer Gomes. \n\nThough her confidence can be abrasive, it does not exceed her skill - she is a master smith. And she is expecting you.
You'll find Artificer Gomes near the forge. It is truly her element.
Speak to Artificer Gomes in the Monarch's Bluffs Settlement.
Here is the one I have heard so much about.\n\nThe fabled warrior Heloise has deputized to help in the settlement's defense.
Forging Ahead
"You think we need allies?"
Exactly. My reputation commands a great deal of respect across all the territories.\n\nI suggested Heloise send me to broker an alliance with the other settlements, but she refused.
"Why would she refuse?"

She believes it's every settlement for itself, and she will not be persuaded otherwise.\n\nThat being the case, we will need extra blades. Show me your skill - open this bag of ore, smelt it, and forge an iron sword. I will judge its merits.
I gave you a full satchel of ore. Smelt it and forge us a sword.\n\nWe will see if your talent extends to the hammer and anvil.
Open the satchel, smelt the ore, and forge an Iron Longsword. Then talk to Artificer Gomes.
Let us see your work! Ah, yes, the blade is sleek, with just the right edge. \n\nIt could use more polish but I see potential here, {playerName}. I am glad to have you in Monarch's Bluffs.
Gather Iron Ore
Craft {itemName}s at the Smelter
Craft an Iron Longsword at the Forge
The Lone Wolf
"Is there anything else you want my help with?"
Indeed. You are sharp, aren't you? \n\nI fear we are also at risk of losing the loyalty of some right here in Monarch's Bluffs. I wonder if you might help me ensure this does not happen.
"That sounds like a worthy cause."

There is one here whose skill matches my own in her discipline - Survivalist Thornton. \n\nShe is very much a 'lone wolf,' and she may be tempted to leave the pack right now. Please speak to her and convince her to stay.
I do hope you will speak to Survivalist Thornton. Losing her would be a death blow to this settlement.
Talk to Survivalist Thornton in the Monarch's Bluffs Settlement.
Sorry, not so much in the mood for conversation right now.\n\nBags to pack, places to be, you understand.
"You're leaving the settlement?"
So what if I am? No business of yours, is it?\n\nWait a minute - Gomes sent you, didn't she? Not much escapes her eye.
Baring Teeth
"That's understandable."
I'm not going anywhere just yet, but it's nice to know I can.\n\nWhat about you, friend? You got what it takes to survive out there on your own?
"I can protect myself."

Sure you can. You know what? Since you and Gomes want to meddle, how about you step up and do a little hunting?\n\nHead out into the wilds and make camp and visit the local wolf dens. I'll wait for you right here.
I don't see any wolf pelts. I think you still have some traveling to do.
Make camp to set respawn point in the wilds and hunt Wolves in Monarch's Bluffs, then return to Survivalist Thornton in the settlement.
Make camp to set a respawn point in the wilds
Defeat {targetName} to collect {itemName}
Collect musk from the wolves of {POITags}
Slay {targetName} for {itemName}
Continue to {POITags} in search of the finest of furs
(Optional) Place the musk to lure out the Alpha of Bayhowl Burrow
Slay {targetName}
Survive the wolves' assault and claim {itemName} from {targetName}
Place the musk to lure the alpha
Hold out against the guardians of Bayhowl Burrow
Intermission
Defeat Bayhowl
Defeat {targetName}
Been out to those wolf dens, have you? You're tougher than you look.\n\nAlright, you made your point. Not like I really wanted to leave the settlement anyways.
Magistrate's Focus
"So you'll help defend the settlement?"
I will, but I can't say Magistrate Bixford does much to inspire confidence around here.\n\nHe's a strange bird, isn't he? And with this Corruption bearing down on us, we need him to be sharp.
"Maybe he needs help."
Don't we all, though? I don't know. Bixford's decent enough. Just… weird.\n\nYou're so eager to help him - you should go check in. Make sure he's keeping focused, if you catch my drift.
See what Bixford's up to. With that one, you never know.
Talk to Magistrate Bixford in the Monarch's Bluffs Settlement.
{playerName}. Just the one I was looking for.\n\nI see you flitting about town, getting to know everyone. It’s exactly what I was hoping for.
Contact the Factions
"Agreed. We need to take action."
So how best to do that? You've seen the Marauders, the Syndicate, and the Covenant, right? \n\nWhether we want to admit it or not, they're the ones best suited to defend Monarch's Bluffs.
"Then we should talk to them."
Indeed, and we should welcome their presence here. \n\nYou should speak with representatives from each faction, and then choose to which you will pledge your allegiance. Choose well and good luck.
Speak with the Factions. They're the ones best suited to defend the settlement.
Talk to representatives from each of the factions, and then speak to Magistrate Bixford.
Speak with representatives from each faction
Speak to the Marauders
Speak to the Syndicate
Speak to the Covenant
Consult with the Magistrate
Well, {playerName}. I hope you've given this some thought.\n\nThe faction you choose to join… if they're the ones in control, it will make or break the settlement.
"It's all up to me."
In a way, yes.\n\nNo pressure, though. Heh.
Marauder Initiation: Reedgill Fishery
"I'm ready to accept it."
The Withered of Reedgill Fishery are the some of the most savage in the region.\n\nWe often hone our combat skills by practicing there.
"Should I go then?"
Yes. Test your mettle at Reedgill Fishery.\n\nIf you find anything of value there, you are welcome to keep it. To the victor go the spoils, as they say.
Yes, you return a more formidable combatant.\n\nFrom now on you will carry yourself as a true warrior, as a Marauder.
The Withered at Reedgill Fishery. They will provide a suitable challenge.
Purge Reedgill Fishery of the Withered and pillage what you find in crates in the area. Then return to Commander Purcell in the Monarch's Bluffs Settlement.
Purge Reedgill Fishery of the Withered and pillage from crates in the area
Syndicate Initiation: Abadier's Anger
"I'm up for a challenge."

There is a ship wrecked nearby by a pirate named Abadier. He was driven mad by his pursuits in alchemy.\n\nHis crew expanded as he claimed he could turn metal to gold. Go to Abadier's Anger and return with what you find.
"What do you expect to find?"
We know gold transmutation to be a pipe dream, but his stock of alchemic components is invaluable to the Syndicate. \n\nIt's those components we're really after.

I have to applaud Abadier's stockpile of alchemic goods.\n\nWe alchemists are known for hoarding various chemicals. We can make good use of the catalyst, but this Azoth Oil leads to so many questions!
"What kind of questions?"
Why are we here, why does azoth grant us such feats, and what makes this island immortal?\n\nYour skills and intellect belong with the Syndicate. I welcome you into our ranks.
Go to the shipwreck, recover the alchemical components, and return.
Explore Abadier's Anger and return any spoils you find to Syndicate Alchemist Tuit in the Monarch's Bluffs Settlement.
Explore Abadier's Anger and loot any spoils you find
Covenant Initiation: Crone's Rest
"I am fully committed."
The Lost are a scourge upon the living, an eternal reminder of our failures. \n\nThey haunt the streets of Crone's Rest, where many of this town's citizens once called home.
"That's terrible."
It would bring comfort to the people of Monarch's Bluffs if you were to go and lay their loved ones to rest. \n\nGo then, help us end their torment.
You've defeated those Lost souls? Thank you, truly.\n\nIt can't have been easy, but the people here will sleep easier for your efforts.
"Glad I could help."
I sense the Spark strongly in you. Your kindness could lead many people to the light.\n\nKeep faith, friend. Goodbye.
Have you faced the Lost of Crone's Rest? Have you shown them the light of the Spark?
Go to Crone's Rest, defeat some Lost, and return to Adjudicator Owgan in the Monarch's Bluffs Settlement.
Go to Crone's Rest and defeat the Lost
Join the Marauders\n OR
Join the Syndicate\n OR
Join the Covenant
Well then, that's that. Only time will tell if you've chosen wisely. \n\nOf course, here on Aeternum, time can be a mysterious thing.
Seriously, it's your choice.
Select your faction by speaking to the Faction Representative of your choice.
Choose Your Allegiance
[BLANK]
Commitment to the Cause
Report back to Constable Saville and let her know your Faction is committed to protecting Monarch's Bluffs
"What about the Corruption?"

Sicherlich! Wir verteidigen die Siedlung gegen jegliche Bedrohung, sei es eine andere Fraktion oder die Verderbnis selbst.\n\nIch weiß, dass die örtlichen Kräfte sehr besorgt sind, deshalb kannst du dafür sorgen, dass die Wachtmeisterin beruhigt schlafen kann.
Sage der Wachtmeisterin, dass sie sich auf die Klingen der Marodeure verlassen kann, egal was kommen mag.
"What about the Corruption?"

Gesetzt dem Fall, dass wir unsere Operation hier festigen können, dann werden wir die Siedlung gegen jede sich uns bietende Gefahr verteidigen.\n\nEs ist mir bewusst, dass die örtlichen Kräfte sehr besorgt sind, deshalb solltest du die Wachtmeisterin beruhigen.
Sage der Wachtmeisterin, dass sie sich darauf verlassen kann, dass das Syndikat für die Sicherheit der Siedlung sorgt.
"What about the Corruption?"

Gerät dein Glaube so schnell ins Wanken? Die Verteidigung der Siedlung ist unser oberstes Gebot. Wir beschützen sie gegen jede Gefahr, sei es eine andere Fraktion oder die Verderbnis.\n\nIch weiß, dass die örtlichen Kräfte von Zweifeln geplagt sind, deshalb ist es an dir, die Wachtmeisterin zu beruhigen.
Sage der Wachtmeisterin, dass sie sich bei der Verteidigung auf das Bündnis verlassen kann, egal was kommen mag.
Ah, {playerName}. Es freut mich, dass du dich einer der Fraktionen angeschlossen hast.\n\nMit deiner Zusicherung glaube ich in der Tat, dass sie die Siedlung verteidigen werden.
Du solltest dich noch einmal mit deinem Fraktionsvertreter unterhalten und einen Auftrag von ihm annehmen.\n\nHalte mich über deine Fortschritte auf dem Laufenden.
Sprich mit deinem Fraktionsvertreter und nimm einen Auftrag von ihm an. Ich warte hier.
Ah, {playerName}. Ich habe mich schon gefragt, wann du wieder einmal vorbeischauen würdest.\n\nMan hört über die Werke von dir und deinen Verbündeten viel Gutes. Weiter so.
Sprich mit deinem Fraktionsvertreter und schaue dir die Fraktionstafel an.
Erfülle eine Fraktionsmission von der Fraktionstafel und melde dich dann beim Magistrat.
Encroaching Corruption
Scour the areas near the Monarch's Bluffs Settlement and destroy any Corruption nodules you find. Then report back to Constable Saville in the Settlement.
"You wouldn't come to their aid?"

Nein. Wenn die Verderbnis Immerfall erreicht, ist das deren Problem.\n\nWir müssen unsere eigene Verteidigung stärken, vor allem nach den Berichten, dass sich die Verderbnis in der Nähe der Siedlung ausbreitet.
"Wie nah an der Siedlung?"

Nah genug, dass wir sie nicht mehr ignorieren können. Ich würde diese Aufgabe gern dir übertragen.\n\nSuche das Gebiet um die Siedlung herum nach der Verderbnis ab, und wenn du etwas findest, vernichte sie.
Sollte die Verderbnis wirklich in der Nähe der Siedlung Fuß fassen, dann müssen wir sie ausradieren.
Suche Wachtmeister Saville auf, um Neues über die Verderbnis zu erfahren.
Ich hoffe, du bringst gute Neuigkeiten mit – ich hatte heute schon genug schlechte Nachrichten.\n\nIst es also wahr? Gibt es neue Ausbrüche der Verderbnis in der Nähe der Siedlung?
"Ja, aber ich habe sie vernichtet."

Das beruhigt mich, zu hören. Die anderen Siedlungen tun mir leid, dass sie nicht jemanden wie dich haben.\n\nDu solltest überlegen, dir in Königsfels ein Haus zu kaufen. Das würde es leichter machen, hierher zurückzukehren.
Suche die aufgeführten Gebiete ab und vernichte alle Anzeichen von Verderbnis:
In der Nähe des Küstenwegs
Entlang der Straße nach Osten
In den Teufelshügeln
Der alte Mann am Fluss
Suche entlang des Flusses in Königsfels nach dem alten Mann. Er weiß vielleicht mehr über die Verderbnis.
"Ist das der Grund für meinen Auftrag?"

Ja, ich fürchte schon. Erinnerst du dich an den Alten, der von der Verderbnis wusste? Er wurde beim Angeln am Fluss im Osten gesehen.\n\nDer Weg nach Osten ist gefährlich, aber er könnte etwas wissen. Frag vor der Abreise bitte im Gasthof nach, ob du im Süden noch mehr erledigen kannst.
Suchst du immer noch den alten Irren? Ja, er könnte durchaus etwas wissen, wenn er noch recht bei Verstand ist.\n\nWobei ich das bezweifle.
Schließe Aufgaben ab, um der Siedlung zu helfen, bevor du den Alten Mann suchst
(Optional) Nutze deine Karte, um schnell zum Geisterschrein zu reisen
Suche nach dem mysteriösen alten Mann am folgenden Ort: {POITags}
"Wie steigere ich meinen Rang?"

Ich wusste gleich, dass in dir der Funke des Ehrgeizes glimmt. Du bist durch und durch ein Marodeur.\n\nWillst du ein Gladiator werden? Absolviere Missionen, um dein Ansehen zu verbessern. Dann kannst du dich der Gladiatorenprüfung am Entermesserriff stellen.
"Wie steigere ich meinen Rang?"

Im Syndikat gibt es keine Abkürzungen. Dein Ansinnen wird viel Zeit und beträchtliche Mühen kosten. \n\nAbsolviere Missionen, um dein Ansehen zu verbessern, damit du ein Skriptor werden kannst. Dann kannst du dich der Skriptorenprüfung in Lichtholz stellen.
"Wie steigere ich meinen Rang?"

Es erfordert ein starkes Herz und viel Mut, um im Orden aufzusteigen.\n\nUm ein Tempelritter zu werden, musst du mittels Missionen Ansehen erlangen und dann die Tempelritterprüfung in Lichtholz absolvieren.
Between Settlements
Search for the missing brooch among the Withered at Mines de Miclot. Then return to Magistrate Bixford in the Monarch's Bluffs Settlement.
"It's civilized, at least."

Yes! You understand - that's why we have to protect this settlement, whatever it takes.\n\nWe've had a bit of a misunderstanding with the settlement in Windsward, but we need to look after ourselves first.
"What happened?"
There's a brooch, an heirloom of sorts. We had agreed to give it to them as a gesture of goodwill.\n\nBut the courier carrying the brooch was waylaid by the Withered, and the brooch was lost.
"Someone should go and reclaim it."

Exactly. I hoped you'd volunteer. The courier took the north road, so check the Withered at the Mines de Miclot.\n\nGo and reclaim it, but then… bring it back here. It's a 'finders-keepers' situation at that point.
You'll find the brooch at the Mines de Miclot.
Ah, {playerName}. I knew you'd come through. \n\nThe brooch is now safe and sound in Monarch's Bluffs where it belongs. Whether Windsward likes it or not.
Search for the missing brooch at the Mines de Miclot
Defeat {targetName} Withered
Collect {itemName} from the {targetName} Withered
True Horrors
Defeat The Abberation in the Mines de Miclot and return to Constable Saville in the Monarch's Bluffs Settlement.
"You wouldn't come to their aid?"
No. If the Corruption spreads to Everfall, that's their problem.\n\nWe have enough horrors of our own to deal with right here in Monarch's Bluffs.
"What kind of horrors?"
The kind that remind us of what might happen if we become Lost.\n\nThere are rumors of some kind of Aberration. If you will go and destroy it, I will see you rewarded generously.
The Aberration must be destroyed as soon as possible.

{playerName}, it is a relief to see you. I must confess - I have been having nightmares about that… thing out there.\n\nI think many here in Monarch's Bluffs will sleep better now that you have destroyed it. Thank you.
Defeat The Abberation in the Mines de Miclot
Defeat {targetName} Withered
Destroy {targetName}
Taste of Honey
Get combs of Devil's Honey from Barkeep Lother's private reserve in the Devil's Pit and return to the Barkeep in the Monarch's Bluffs Settlement.
"What do people say, exactly?"
They say you've been quite a help, and I was like, 'well, why haven't they helped me?'\n\nBut then I realized, silly Geertie, it's because you haven't asked!
"Is there something you need help with?"

Yes! Honey! Honey so delicious it's called 'Devil's Honey'... It also comes from Devil's Gorge.\n\nCollect my honeycombs, and I'll give you a taste. But whatever you do, don't touch ANYTHING in Devil's Gorge except those apiaries.
Just wait until you taste this honey.
Aha! There's my honey… I mean my honeycombs. I wasn't calling you 'my honey'. That would be... absurd.\n\nBut yes, this is fantastic! I'm going to whip us up some honeycakes right away.
Collect combs of Devil's Honey from the Devil's Pit
Collect Devil's Honey
Dagger in the Mist
Search The Grey Mist and The Dagger for jars of wine and return to Barkeep Lother.
"Depends on the favor."

Seeing as how everyone is talking about 'battening down the hatches' here to protect against Corruption. I think we need to stock up on booze.\n\nAnd I think I might know a spot to get our hands on some perfectly aged wine from the Old World.
"Where would this wine be?"

Couple of shipwrecks out on the coast - the Dagger and the Grey Mist. \n\nIf you'll go there and grab as many jars of wine as you can find, we'll shack up and ride this thing out… I mean, not just the two of us, but everyone in the settlement, of course.
Oh man, the Old World wine from those shipwrecks... I can't wait.
Oh yeah, I can feel the party coming on already!\n\nWe got wine and honeycakes - it's gonna be a feast! Just let me finish making preparations.
Travel to {POITags}
Collect jars of Dagger Wine
Search the Wrecks of the Grey Mist and the Dagger for Jars of Wine
Collect jars of Grey Mist Wine
Traitorous Weaponry
Retrieve broken weapons from Turncoat Pirates around Traitor's Hold and bring them to Artificer Gomes along the roads to the Southeast.
"I've been working with the {playerFaction}"

That's a good start, but Saville should be prioritizing further alliances as well.\n\nWithout allies, we will certainly need more weapons to fully stock the arsenal, more weapons than even I can forge.
"Where can we find more weapons?"

There is one possibility - the Lost Pirates of Traitor's Hold bear weapons fresh enough to still be useful.\n\nIf you will collect as many weapons as you can from Traitor's Hold, then we will at least have a fighting chance.
The weapons from Traitor's Hold may be our only way to properly stock the arsenal.
Ah, {playerName}. I am glad you've returned. Now, let me see these weapons.\n\nHm. They are useable, but the steel is less durable than I had hoped. Either way, they will have to suffice for now.
Retrieve broken weapons from Turncoat Pirates around Traitor's Hold
Collect {itemName} from Turncoat Pirates
Friends in Fashion
Find pieces of tattered silk from skeletons in the Divine Rise and return them to Survivalist Lee in the Everfall Settlement.
"What do you propose?"
Hate to say it, but Gomes is right. We need to be finding allies.\n\nI got an idea - it's a little out there, but it might at least earn us a friend.
"We should give it a shot."

So, Survivalist Lee is influential over in Everfall. He's also got an obsession with fashion, er, clothes, you know.\n\nI know, right? But bring him some Ancient textiles as a gift, and we'll have at least one ally out there.
It's worth a shot with Survivalist Lee. I'm telling you, he really goes wild for the Ancients' silk and textiles. I've heard of weirder things.
What's this? Ooh! Such fine silk, and quite a familiar quality… timeless both in durability and in style.\n\nTell me, where did you find these, and what do you want in exchange? Name your price.
"A gift from Monarch's Bluffs."

A gift? For me? How generous… someone knows my tastes too. Comes with the territory.\n\nWell, do tell Monarch's Bluffs that everyone in the settlement has earned a friend in Survivalist Lee. I mean it.
Find pieces of tattered silk from skeletons at Antares and Achernar
Collect Tattered Silk from Celestial Ancient Guardians in Achernar or Antares
Destroy {targetName}
Destroy {targetName}
Search {targetName} for a {itemName}
Ancient Craftsmanship
Collect Ancient Artifacts from Antares and Achernar so Artificer Gomes can extract azoth and use it to strengthen the arsenal's armors in Monarch's Bluffs.
"Is it something I can help with?"

Yes. Magistrate Bixford, for all his shortcomings, often has genius insights, and such is the case today.\n\nOver the years we have learned that armors of the Ancient Guardians are incredibly strong, and seem not to have aged at all.
"You want to use the Ancient Guardians' armor?"

Not so much the armors themselves, but there are azoth-infused artifacts in the ruins of Antares and Archenar.\n\nRecover these artifacts, and I can extract what we need to strengthen our own armors against Corruption.
If we are able to extract what we need from the Ancients' artifacts, I begin to hope we can fight the Corruption when it comes.

Aha! {playerName}, my friend, you have done it again. Just look at these artifacts!\n\nI will get to work on the extractions right away, and with luck, I will use it to fortify the armor we have in the arsenal.
Collect Ancient Artifacts from Antares and Achernar
Search chests in Achernar for the {itemName}
Search chests in Antares for the {itemName}
Spoiled Feast
Go to the Farside Township and harvest a Squash for Barkeep Lother in the Monarch's Bluffs Settlement.
"What happened?"

I was all set, had the stew brewing and everything, and then I go to add the vegatables, and they're spoiled.\n\nIt's the third time this season. I'm beginning to think all the crops in the region are ruined.
"How can we find out?"

I'm not sure. There's a theory that the spoiled crops might have something to do with the Withered.\n\nSuppose it's worth a check. Farside Township - it's overrun these days. If you can find some squash growing, bring it back and I'll take a look.
If you can get us a squash from Farside Township, hopefully we can start to figure out what's spoiling all our crops.
Well, look at that! That squash is about as healthy as any I've ever seen!\n\nWhat gives, then? Our crops are all getting spoiled, while the ones on the farm overrun by the Withered are fine?
Harvest a Healthy Squash from Farside Township
Harvest some Healthy Squash
Root of the Problem
Collect evidence of the spoiled crops in Lakeside Farm and bring it to Constable Saville in the Monarch's Bluffs Settlement.
"We'll find a solution."
Perhaps. I've half a mind to strike out on my own at this point.\n\nIf I'm gonna stay, you're gonna have to help me convince Saville to do something.
"How should I accomplish that?"
I don't know. You're the genius here - I'm just a common survivalist. \n\nI'd say gather some spoiled crops from the Lakeside Farm, then deliver them to Saville. Worth a shot, I say.
Get some spoiled crops from from the Lakeside Farm and give them to Saville. Good luck - we need it!
{playerName}, it's excellent to see you, as always.\n\nI hear you're investigating our spoiled crops. Have we found any that aren't ruined?
"This corn from the Lakeside Farm."
Let me see… oh yes, this seems to be quite healthy.\n\nThat means we do have a significant quantity of food, perhaps more than we need…
Collect evidence of spoiled crops from Lakeside Farm
Harvest Corn from Lakeside Farm
Goodwill Squashing
Harvest a Prize Squash from Tres Campos, then deliver it to Barkeeper Cormack as proof that the crops from Withered Farms are unspoilt.
"That's understandable."
I've heard the crops in Windsward are all coming up spoilt, too.\n\nI wonder if they've realized the Withered farms crops are alright.
"We should tell them."

I don't know... Saville isn't keen on us sharing secrets with other settlements.\n\nBut it's the right thing. Alright. There were amazing Squashes at Tres Campos. Snatch one and take it to Barkeep Cormack in Windsward. Our secret though.
Gotta admit, sharing this knowledge with Windsward makes me nervous, but it's the right thing. Good luck.
Now that is a squash! Is that from Monarch's Bluffs? \n\nHow in tarnation… I thought you all had the same problem as us - everything's spoiled.
"The Withered farms are healthy."
So that's the trick, then? Harvest from the Withered farms… that's a hot tip.\n\nThis'll really help us out. Maybe I got the folks from Monarch's Bluffs all wrong after all.
Harvest a Prize Squash from Tres Campos
Harvest a Squash
Arruda Jam
Clear Withered from Arruda Ranch and look for Arruda Jam Jars to replenish stock in the Monarch's Bluffs settlement.
"Leverage for what?"
Think about it - if the crops are failing in the territories of our neighbors, they're desperate.\n\nWe can supply them with our healthy crops, and they'll thank us for it.
"It could win us some allies."
Better yet, an obscene profit! In fact, the old Arruda Ranch was famous for its delicious jam.\n\nGo clear the Withered there and see if you can find some unspoiled jam. It would be quite a boon.
Visit Arruda Ranch and try to find some of that famous jam they made. If it's unspoiled, we're in luck.
Oh my goodness, look at this! Arruda Jam! The most delicious.\n\nAnd this stuff goes a long way. This will keep our settlement fed and then some!
Clear Withered from Arruda Ranch and look for Arruda Jam
Destroy Bileblight Withered
Collect Arruda Jam
Time Will Tell
Defeat Bloodheart Pirates in Brigand Bastion and loot their supplies to weaken their grip on the pass. Then report to Magistrate Korrapati in the Windsward Settlement.
"Isn't that a good thing?"
Only time will tell. I'm grateful, however, if this means that we may finally deal with the Bloodheart Pirates. \n\nConstable Saville has her own agenda, but I have mine as well.
"I can help both of you."

I hoped as much. Heloise has her sights on the Bloodheart's leader. \n\nBut weakening their hold on Brigand Bastion will help Windsward more. Assault the Bastion and report your success to Magistrate Korrapati in Windsward. She will be pleased - I am sure of it.
The logistics of conflict and engagement become murky when both you and your enemy are immortal. Could Sun Tzu have envisioned an island on which no one truly dies?
Are the rumors true, then? You went and sorted out the Bloodheart Pirates in Brigand Bastion?\n\nI must confess - I am still uncertain of Magistrate Bixford's intentions.
"Yes, I attacked the Bastion at his request."
Then I suppose I will have put my skepticism aside henceforth.\n\nI thank you for your part in helping bridge the divide between Windsward and Monarch's Bluffs.
Defeat Bloodheart Pirates in Brigand Bastion and loot their supplies
Destroy {targetName} Pirates
Search chests for {itemName} at {POITags}
Bloody History
Collect gems from caches in the wreckage of the Montore Expedition, but beware of Madman Montore and his band of Bloodhearts. Then report to Constable Saville in the Monarch's Bluffs Settlement.
"What changed your mind?"
You should know. I received a message, thanking us for telling them how to find healthy crops.\n\nI think perhaps I've been looking at this situation all wrong.
"Monarch's Bluffs and Windsward could be allies."
Indeed, and as a gesture of goodwill, I've sent back their Heirloom Brooch. \n\nI would like to go even further however, and deal with a problem that plagues both territories.
"That sounds like a good start."

Indeed, with your support. The Bloodheart Pirates have raided the roads for years, and they're sitting on a cache of valuable gems.\n\nDestroy their leader and steal their gems. We will share the spoils with Windsward.
Madman Montore is no one to trifle with. You'd best prepare if you would go to Deadman's Cove by yourself.
You're back… and you have the gems. My goodness, they are indeed stunning.\n\nTell me, did you face Madman Montore? Will he still raid our supply caravans?
"Montore has been defeated."
Excellent! Our new allies will be as relieved as I am, I am sure.\n\nI will make arrangements to send half… or perhaps a little more than half of these gemstones to Windsward as well.
Collect gems from caches in the wreckage of the Montore Expedition
Defeat {targetName} Pirates
Collect {itemName}s from chests
Between Innkeeps
"I'm the venturing type."

Fantastic! I've run up a little debt with Innkeep Fairfax over in First Light - she loaned me some azoth.\n\nIf you'll go tell her the azoth is coming soon, she'll pay the cost for you to fast travel back.
"Fast travel back?"
Well, yes. It just costs a little azoth… like everything else, right?\n\nBut yes, if you'll give her my message and return, I'll give you a little azoth myself.
Hello there. Welcome to First Light! Wait, do I know you?\n\nOr have you come from Monarch's Bluffs? Innkeep Biton sent you, didn't he?
"Yes, he'll send your azoth soon."
Oh, he'd better. I heard he's had an influx of new arrivals lately.\n\nBastard was probably too cheap to give you azoth to fast travel back, wasn't he? Fine, fine. Here you go.
I do appreciate you delivering my message to Innkeep Fairfax.\n\nShe'll give you enough azoth to fast travel back.
Inform Innkeep Fairfax in First Light that Innkeep Biton in Monarch's Bluffs will repay her azoth soon.
Fast Travel Home
[BLANK]
Open the Map and (optional) Fast Travel back to Monarch's Bluffs
Well now, that was quicker than I expected.\n\nI hope it went alright. She wasn't too irritated, was she?
"She wasn't happy."
Of course not, but perhaps no broken legs coming my way.\n\nThank you for going all the way out there, {playerName}. As promised, here's a little more azoth. Oh, and you can keep your free room!
[BLANK}
Open your map and use the azoth from the Innkeep to fast travel back to Monarch's Bluffs.
Anzahlung
Spüre die Arbeiter auf, die Giacomo verraten haben.
"Abenteurerherberge? Was ist das?"

Ein Ort, an dem müde Reisende sich ausruhen können, natürlich! Ich bin Giacomo Altoviti, der Architekt. Hast du vielleicht schon von mir gehört? Nein? \n\nNun, du hättest es, wenn meine Arbeiter mir nicht – buchstäblich – in den Rücken gestochen und mit meinem Design-Notizbuch und Werkzeugen davongelaufen wären.
"Was ist so wichtig an diesen Skizzen?"

Auf dieser Insel wimmelt es von Überlebenden, die kein Zuhause, keine Wurzeln mehr haben. Ich möchte ihnen das zurückgeben. \n\nSicherheit ist immer das größte Anliegen. Ich kann diese Sicherheit in einem viel kleineren Maßstab schaffen.
"Haben dich deine Arbeiter deshalb verraten?"

Die Bastardi haben mich mit nichts zurückgelassen. Aber du bist hier, also gibt es Hoffnung! 

Der Gasthofbetreiber hat vor einigen Tagen Arbeiter dabei beobachtet, wie sie sich über ein Notizbuch voller "Geheimnisse" unterhielten. Verdächtig, nicht wahr? 

Wenn du ihre Verfolgung schon mal aufnehmen könntest, bringe ich meine Aufgabe noch zu Ende und komme dann nach!
Deine Hilfe ist sehr willkommen. Sobald wir mein Notizbuch haben, habe ich große Pläne. Sie werden ganz Aeternum verändern! \nUnd du wirst reich belohnt, keine Angst!
Ist das mein Notizbuch? Oh! Oh, grazie! \n\nUnd was ist mit diesen diebischen Angreifern? Der, der das Buch hatte, war verderbt! Haha! Ein würdiges Ende seiner Gier und seines Verrats!
"Was hast du als Nächstes geplant?"

Jetzt beginnt die Arbeit! Die Sicherheit der Abenteurerherberge wird die von ihren Reisen müden Menschen willkommen heißen. \n\nMein Ziel ist es, dass jeder auf Aeternum sein eigenes Zuhause hat. Und deswegen … nimm dies für dein eigenes Heim.
Spüre das erste Lager der Verräter auf.
Suche den Tagebucheintrag "Pfad des Verräters".
Verfolge die Verräter bis zu ihrem zweiten Lager.
Suche den Tagebucheintrag "Brennende Gier".
Folge den Verrätern bis zum Chason-Steilhang.
Suche am Chason-Steilhang nach dem Lager der Verräter.
Untersuche die Truhe in dem verlassenen Lager.
Untersuche die Truhe.
Besiege den Verräter und erbeute: {itemName}
Eine beträchtliche Investition
Kaufe ein Haus und dekoriere es.
"Ein Haus klingt doch gut."

Es ist eine Zufluchtsstätte! Eine Oase, die nach einem langen Tag auf dich wartet. Es lässt dich Wurzeln schlagen. 

Und Geisterschreine können dich von überall auf der Insel sanft hineinsetzen! 

Um das wirklich verstehen zu können, musst du dein eigenes Zuhause erwerben.
"Aber ist das nicht … viel zu teuer?"

Gelegenheiten gibt es hier im Überfluss! Schau dich um, und du wirst schon was für deine Münzen finden. \n\nSobald du ein Zuhause hast, stelle doch die Möbel auf, die ich dir gegeben habe. Kreiere dein eigenes Reich. Kehre dann zu mir zurück, denn es gibt noch mehr zu tun!
Es mag nicht einfach sein, das nötige Kapital für dein erstes Heim zusammenzutragen, aber es wird sich lohnen.
Wie schön, du bist zurück! Und du siehst stärker und wohlhabender aus als zuvor. \n\nDu hast also ein Haus gekauft, ja?
"Es hat einige Zeit gedauert, aber jetzt habe ich ein Zuhause."

Bravo! Jetzt siehst du, dass mit einem Zuhause alles besser ist. Da du dieses Gefühl jetzt kennst, können wir unsere Beziehung weiter pflegen. \n\nOh, und hier ist ein kleines Geschenk zum Einzug. Congratulazioni!
Kaufe ein Haus und hebe deine Dekorationspunktzahl auf mehr als 1.
Sichere Investition
Begib dich zum Mauerbruch und zur Fong-Plantage und sammle dort für Giacomo frisches Blut und Knochen von Hutzeligen
"Du meinst Wachen und Verteidigungsanlagen?"

Äh, so etwas in der Art. Ich habe den Standort ausgewählt, um das Fundament vorzubereiten, aber ich brauche ein paar Dinge. \n\nJemand aus Erstes Licht hat mir eine Rezeptur überlassen, in der Blut und Knochen dieser hutzeligen … Dinger … in den Mörtel eingearbeitet werden.
"Warum um alles in der Welt brauchen wir das?"

Es wirkt abweisend. Ich habe versucht, diese Gegenstände selbst zu bekommen, aber ein Architekt hat seine Grenzen. Ich bin sicher, du bist der Aufgabe gewachsen! \nGanz in der Nähe gibt es zwei Orte, die dafür wie gemacht erscheinen. Triff mich auf der Baustelle, wenn du alles zusammengetragen hast.

Um ehrlich zu sein, weiß ich nicht genau, wie das mit den Knochen und dem Blut funktioniert, aber mein Freund, der Überlebenskünstler, schwört darauf. Ich dachte mir, es ist besser, auf Nummer sicher zu gehen, oder?

Willkommen auf der Baustelle der ersten Abenteurerherberge! Noch sieht es nicht nach viel aus, aber ich verspreche dir … das wird sich bald ändern! \nHast du die gruseligen Materialien gesammelt, die ich brauche?
"Ich habe all das, was du brauchst, und sogar noch mehr."

Perfetto, grazie! Warte, das ist meine Rezeptur … wie konnte …? 

Sie muss während meines Rückzugs aus meinem Skizzenbuch gerutscht sein. Der Madonna sei Dank, dass du sie gefunden hast! 

Ähm, anscheinend braucht das Rezept mehr als nur Blut und Knochen.
Begib dich an folgenden Ort, um frisches Blut von Hutzeligen für Giacomo zu sammeln: {POITags}
Begib dich an folgenden Ort, um frische Knochen von Hutzeligen für Giacomo zu sammeln: {POITags}
Sammle: {itemName}
Suche im Bauernhaus nach dem Tagebucheintrag "Verteidigung gegen die Hutzeligen".
Sichere Investition (Teil 2)
Sammle Grabnesseln vom Friedhof von Ruhendes Ärgernis und bringe sie zu Giacomo.
"Grabnesseln?"

Si, diese Pflanzen findet man oft auf und in der Nähe von Gräbern. Einige Leute gehen immer noch durch die Zeremonie für diejenigen, die verloren sind. \nÖstlich von hier ist ein Friedhof, auf dem du das finden solltest, wonach wir suchen.
"Möchtest du nicht mitkommen?"
Ähm, nein, die Baukunst ist meine Domäne, nicht der Kampf. \n\nAußerdem sollte ich das Fundament vorbereiten und für deine Rückkehr bereithalten.
Scusi, ich will mich nicht aufdrängen, aber ich bin sicher, wenn du das Ergebnis siehst, wirst du staunen.
Hast du meine Errungenschaft gesehen? Fantastischer Fortschritt, nicht wahr? Das Fundament ist fast fertig. Ich hatte sogar Zeit, Lager für Vorräte hinzuzufügen! \n\nHast du die Grabnesseln gefunden?
"Ja, mehr als genug."

Bravo! Perfetto! Diese in Boden und Wände einzuarbeiten, sollte verhindern, dass diese schrecklichen Geister unsere Gäste belästigen. \n\nOh, und das Lager, das ich erwähnt habe? Du kannst es zu deinem eigenen Zuhause hinzufügen! Stell dich davor und probiere es aus.
Begib dich an folgenden Ort, um Grabnesseln für Giacomo zu sammeln: {POITags}
Sammle {itemName} bei Gräbern in {POITags}.
Baustelleninspektion
Trage die Baumaterialien für Giacomo zusammen und gehe den Informationen über den nächsten Verräter nach.
"Das ist nur ein Problem."

Si, si! Mir geht auch langsam das Material aus. Ich hatte das Projekt mit einer Crew im Rücken geplant, aber wir haben ja gesehen, wie sich das entwickelt hat. Tja, bis der Bau fertig ist, muss sich jemand um die Verteidigung der Baustelle kümmern. \n\nIch habe eine Liste mit dem, was ich brauche, wenn du bereit bist?
"Ich sehe mal nach, was ich finden kann."

Wunderbar! Wenn ich dich doch nur früher gefunden hätte, anstatt diese Narren, dann wären wir vor Monaten fertig geworden. \n\nNoch einmal, Grazie. Du bist ein Segen für alle guten Seelen. Per favore, bitte nimm dies als kleines Zeichen meiner Dankbarkeit.
Ich habe meinen Vorrat fast aufgebraucht. \n\nAber ich vertraue darauf, dass du die Angelegenheit zügig regelst und mit guten Neuigkeiten und Vorräten zurückkehren wirst!

Bentornato! Du kommst mit vielen Geschenken! 

Und du hast den Schurken getroffen und meinen Kompass zurückgebracht! Sei Magnifico! 

Ah, meine Mama hat mir diesen Kompass geschenkt, als ich meine Reise angetreten habe … Ich wünschte ich könnte sie noch einmal wiedersehen …
"Ich habe auch diese Notiz gefunden."

Diese Idioti sind hinter Geld her? Das ist alles? 

Es ging noch nie um Geld! Ich tue dies für jeden auf Aeternum! Nicht nur die Reichen! 

Wie auch immer, würdest du mir dabei helfen, die letzten Arbeiten an dem Gebäude zu erledigen?
Magnifico! Jetzt haben Reisende einen Zufluchtsort vor den Gefahren und Schrecken dieser Insel. \n\n Das ist mein Traum: Ein Zuhause für jeden, der es braucht.
"Ein edler Traum."

Welchen wir teilen müssen! Mein Teil ist es, mehr Häuser zu bauen, sobald ich aufstocke. 

Was dich betrifft, so reicht mein Dank nicht aus. Nimm das hier, bitte. Das ist das Mindeste, was ich tun kann. 

Vielleicht komme ich auf dich zurück, wenn ich in Zukunft Hilfe brauche.
Beschaffe Folgendes, indem du es findest, herstellst oder kaufst: {itemName}
Reise an folgenden Ort und suche nach dem Verräter: {POITags}
Suche im Zelt nach dem Tagebucheintrag "Stimmen im Wind".
Besiege den Verräter und erbeute: {itemName}
Kehre mit dem Material und dem Kompass zu Giacomo zurück.
Schließe die Bauarbeiten an der Abenteurerherberge ab.
Zwingende Verbesserungen
Sammle die Materialien für Giacomos Rezeptur und stelle dann die Ahnenschutzsteine in einem Arkanumarchiv her.
"Freut mich, zu hören."

Hör gut zu – ich habe herausgefunden, wie die Ahnen einige ihrer Anlagen geschützt haben. Ah! Ah! \n\nDieses Geheimnis könnte die Abenteurerherberge besser schützen! Es könnte die Zukunft Aeternums verändern!
"Das ist ja fantastisch."

Certo! Die Ahnen haben Schutzsteine für ihre Stätten erschaffen. Leider habe ich den letzten meiner Steine verwendet, um die erste Abenteurerherberge zu schützen. \n\nWenn ich dir diese Rezeptur gebe … könntest du mir dann welche für diesen Standort anfertigen?
Weil ich vorsichtig bin, werde ich einige Schritte dieser Rezeptur für mich behalten … zumindest fürs Erste. Doch mit der Zeit werde ich mein Wissen teilen. Aber nicht, um Profit zu machen!

Bentornato! Und gerade rechtzeitig! Diese Straße ist gut befahren. Ich hatte alle Hände voll zu tun, die von der weniger freundlichen Sorte fernzuhalten. \n\nIst es dir gelungen, die Steine herzustellen, um die ich dich gebeten hatte?
"Ja, hier sind sie!"

Wunderbar! Wenn ich dich doch nur früher gefunden hätte, anstatt diese Idioti, dann wären wir vor Monaten fertig geworden. \n\nNoch einmal, grazie. Du bist ein Segen für alle guten Seelen. Per favore, nimm dies als kleines Zeichen meiner Dankbarkeit.
Im Bronzehain:
In den Oberen:
Sammle {itemName} von {targetName}.
Sammle {itemName} von {targetName}.
Sammle {itemName} in der Nähe von Sternenmetalladern an folgendem Ort: {POITags}
Stelle die Ahnenschutzsteine in einem Arkanumarchiv her.
Abschlusskosten
Spüre Airic Niclisson auf, den Anführer der Gruppe, die Giacomo verraten hat.
"Ihr Anführer ist dieser … Airic?"

Si, Airic Niclisson, der Vorarbeiter meiner verräterischen Mannschaft. Ich bin sicher, er war der Drahtzieher ihres Plans. \n\nDas Problem ist, ich habe keine Nachricht von ihm erhalten, was bedeutet, dass sich der Schurke versteckt.
"Was willst du tun?"

Ich habe mich schon wegen ihm umgehört. Aber dieses Mal muss ich mitmachen. Ich werde nach Norden reisen und versuchen, dort etwas herauszufinden. \n\nDu solltest bei Gasthofbetreiberin Lam in Klagental nachfragen. Sie sollte wissen, wenn sich Fremde in der Gegend aufhalten.

Ich suche noch Vorräte für die Reise zusammen und breche dann auf. Ich hoffe, dass ich Airic selbst finden werde. Aber ich weiß nicht, was ich dann tun soll. \n\nZumindest werde ich herausfinden, was mit dem Rest meiner Werkzeuge geschehen ist … Alles andere wird sich finden. Ich wünsche dir viel Glück!
Willkommen in Lams Zuflucht. Das hier ist der beste Ort, um die Azoth-Bäche Klagentals zu genießen.
"Giacomo schickt mich. Gibt es was Neues?"

Ich fragte mich, ob er selbst kommen würde. Ich bin froh, dass er schlau war und jemanden geschickt hat, der fähiger ist. \n\nDer Mann, nach dem er sucht, ist vor Kurzem vorbeigekommen. Er sagte, er suche nach Artefakten der Ahnen, um ein Projekt abschließen zu können. Dann ist er nach Nordosten weitergezogen.

Hey! Gibt es was Neues? 

Du hast ihn gefunden! Was sagte dieser Schurke angesichts seiner Verbrechen? 

E fatta. Er hat bekommen, was er verdient.
"Das hier habe ich unterwegs gefunden."

Mein Plumbumm! Ich bin überrascht, dass er es behalten hat. Dies war ein Geschenk meines guten Freundes und Lehrers Giulio. \n\nGrazie. Du warst mehr als ein Freund. Diese Trophäenstücke mögen nicht viel sein, aber sie werden mit Zuneigung geschenkt!
Sprich mit Gasthofbetreiberin Lam in der Klagental-Siedlung und finde heraus, ob sie weiß, wo sich Airic aufhält.
Suche an diesem Ort nach Hinweisen auf Airic Niclisson: {POITags}
Suche im Lager nach dem Tagebucheintrag "Auf den Spuren der Ahnen".
Folge Airics Spur nach Norden an diesen Ort: {POITags}
Untersuche die zurückgelassenen Taschen.
Folge Airic an diesen Ort: {POITags}
